review: I purchased Apple TV because my old mini Mac finally got to the point where I could not upgrade it enough to stream video on Netflix.  I didn't really need a computer and didn't want to spend that kind of money, but I needed something to connect to my HDTV to stream video.This is what I like about Apple TV:1.  Easy to set up.  Just plug in the HDMI cable and go.  It picks up on the wifi immediately and I plugged my ethernet cable directly into it so it would run faster.2.  Picture quality is excellent.3. Easy to operate -- simple navigation and you can control it from your iPhone or iPad.  That is especially useful for the sites that you need to log into.  It's much faster to do it on the tablet or smartphone.Here is what I don't like about Apple TV:1. No Pandora2. No speakers. My Altec Lansing digital speakers cannot be connected to the Apple TV box nor does it recognize my Bose Soundlink bluetooth speaker.  This leaves me at the mercy of the speaker built into the TV.  I'm not sure how to connect external speakers to my TV so for the time being I just plugged them into the headphone jack, which helps but is not ideal.3.  I can't stream amazon video or music.  Yes, I know I could have purchased Fire TV but I figured it would be full of advertising like my Kindle Fire is.  So I opted for Apple.4. No web browser (this would solve the Pandora and amazon video problem.....)For $69 I can't complain.  It's much better than paying for cable or satellite TV.Once I figure out the speaker issue I will be a lot happier but for now I am satisfied.
